concept.title: Electrical Systems
concept.shortdesc: Components and functions of automotive electrical systems.

section.title: Overview
section.p: The electrical system in modern vehicles performs numerous essential functions including starting the engine, generating and storing power, ignition, lighting, and supporting electronic control systems.

ul.li: Battery: Stores electrical energy in chemical form
Alternator: Generates electricity while engine is running
Starter: Electric motor that initiates engine operation
Wiring Harness: Organized bundle of wires distributing electricity
Fuses and Relays: Protection and switching devices
Electronic Control Units (ECUs): Specialized computers controlling various systems

section.title: Battery System
section.p: The battery provides electrical energy when the engine is not running:

ul.li: Stabilizes voltage in the electrical system
Provides power when engine is off
Hybrid and electric vehicles use additional high-voltage battery systems

section.title: Charging System
section.p: The charging system replenishes the battery and powers electrical systems while running:

ul.li: Alternator converts mechanical energy to electrical energy
Voltage regulator maintains consistent output voltage
Charges battery and powers vehicle electrical loads

section.title: Starting System
section.p: Components that work together to start the engine:

ul.li: Flywheel or flexplate with ring gear
Safety switches (neutral safety switch, clutch switch)
Tail lights, brake lights, and turn signals
